text: Babatunde Osotimehin (6 February 1949 â€“ 4 June 2017) was a Nigerian public servant and United Nations official. Osotimehun was appointed on 19 November 2010 as the new Executive Director of UNFPA, the United Nations Population Fund, for a four-year term. He was reappointed to this position on 21 August 2014. He assumed the position on 1 January 2011 and became the organisation's fourth Executive Director. He held the rank of Under-Secretary-General of the United Nations. Before, he was Nigeria's Minister of Health. He left this office in March 2010 when Acting President Goodluck Jonathan dissolved his cabinet. ==References== Category:1949 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Nigerian politicians Category:United Nations officials Category:People from Ogun State
title: Babatunde Osotimehin
